newsitem.title: USA: Destron Fearing gets $3 mln credit line.
newsitem.headline: Destron Fearing gets $3 mln credit line.

text.p: Destron Fearing Corp said it received a new $3 million revolving credit facility with Coast Business Credit.
The company also said it reached an agreement with Hughes Aircraft Co to convert approximately $4.3 million in accounts payable into a 27-month installment note.
"These very positive agreements are the final pieces in our plan to strengthen the company's financial position," Randolph Geissler, president, said in a statement.

The Hughes note provides for monthly principal payments of $125,000 in the current fiscal year, with higher payments in subsequent fiscal years. Interest rate on the unpaid balance of the note is variable, beginning at 7.25 percent and increasing to 11.25 percent during the 1999 fiscal year.
Hughes Aircraft is a unit of Hughes Electronics Corp.
The new revolving credit facility replaces a previous credit line agreement with a bank. It will be used for general corporate working capital needs.
Destron Fearing makes electronic and visual identification devices for companion animals, livestock, laboratory animals, fish and wildlife.
